page.title: 17COMMUNICATION AND TRANSPORT
page.content: The A12 trunk road from Great Yarmouth to London passes through this area. It carries a wide variety of {traffic} including goods vehicles of all kinds, service buses, coaches, private cars and bicycles. Early in 1985 the Ministry of Transport proposed the degrading of this road to that of a 'B' category but this suggestion met with such strong opposition that, for the time being, the proposal has been dropped. The road enables vehicles using the nearby industrial estate to {transport} goods easily and vehicles from the port of Lowestoft use this road to take goods to London. Public transport in the area is provided by buses of the Eastern Counties Omnibus Company enabling residents of Pakefield to {travel} to Lowestoft, Oulton Broad, Carlton Colville and Kessingland. The services are regular but infrequent.
